description: From Latin expiscatus, past participle of expiscari (“to fish out”), from ex (“out”) + piscari (“to fish”), piscis (“fish”).

verbs.description: expiscate (third-person singular simple present expiscates, present participle expiscating, simple past and past participle expiscated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, formal, archaic) To fish out; to find out by skill or laborious investigation; to search out.
examples: Mathematics may be separated into two divisions, one of which expiscates principles or methods, and the other rules or applications.
